item.title: Solid Waste
item.description: PlaNYC is a comprehensive sustainability plan for New York City’s future. Goal: Divert 75% of solid waste from landfills. Divert Solid Waste Of the city’s 13.6 million tons of waste per year, we currently recycle 51% of solid waste (including fill) and send 43% to landfills. The remainder is composted or converted to energy. We are working to increase the amount diverted to recycling, composting, and conversion to 75%. Diverting solid waste from landfills to recycling and conversion facilities make use of our waste, creating new materials, nutrient sources, and energy out of our waste products.
